eecs.jago.element
Class Building

java.lang.Object

                    +--eecs.jago.element.Building
All Implemented Interfaces:
Collidable, java.lang.Runnable, Visible
public class Building
extends SolidElement

A Building represents any SolidElement in the simulation that appears as a large rectangular object, generally with the appearance of a building. The standard Building has several predifined appearances (specified by a type parameter), which can be extended by the user by adding additional images with unique identifiers. Buildings can also be created using an explicitly defined file name. All Buildings must have an image (they do not just have a texture), and the size is automatically assigned to be equal to the size of the image.

Since:
4.1

Constructor Detail

Building

public Building(int type)
Creates a Building of the specified type. The type number must specify a building in the images directory with the name format of building_x.gif where x is the type number.

Parameters:
type - An integer identifier for the building

Building

public Building(java.lang.String imageName)
Creates a Building using the supplied image to determine appearance and size. If the image does not exist, an empty rectangle will be used instead.

Parameters:
imageName - The name of the image. The image must be in the user directory or in a subdirectory of the package labeled images.
Method Detail

setType

protected void setType(int type)
Sets the type of building. Normally only called from the constructor.

Parameters:
type - The integer identifier for the building
